alert.note: Alert for Granville (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Vance, southern Granville, north central Wake and west central Franklin Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Creedmoor, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Creedmoor, Wake Forest, Franklinton, Youngsville, Falls Lake, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Falls Lake Boat Ramp and Purnell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Dont wait until you see the first lightning flash before heading to safety. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
